ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.
M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported
e.g., Baseline, 6-Month Follow Up, Year 2; Morning, At Bedtime

ElementDescription: Miscellaneous comments on study, interview, methodology relevant to this form data
How important is it to make mental health services available in the primary care office for patients who present with oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
To what extent are there obstacles to making mental health services available in primary care for oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How often do you screen or assess for oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How often do you provide any treatment for oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How often do you refer patients to outside providers for oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How capable or competent do you feel in treating oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How effective have you been in treating oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How interested are you in receiving additional training or information to enhance your efforts to treat oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
How interested are you in collaborating with an on-site mental health resource to enhance your efforts to treat oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?
In the last 6 months, for what percentage of cases like this did you provide any Doctor Office Collaborative Care (DOCC) services to address oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD?

In the last 6 months, what percentage of the proposed components in the Doctor Office Collaborative Care (DOCC) model did your care team providers routinely deliver to address oppositional or aggressive behavior and/or ADHD (e.g., collect ongoing patient assessment information, review patient registry, deliver treatment content from the manual, follow medication guidelines for those with ADHD, hold collaborative care team meetings/discuss problem cases)?
